properties.Name: Adana Ethnography Museum
properties.Description: In the western section, inscriptions from the Turkish-Islamic works are exhibited. The most prominent examples among them are the restoration inscriptions of Misis Inn, Adana Governor's Bureau, Bahripasa Fountain, Taskopru, Misis Bridge and the Ottoman St

properties.Name: Adana Ataturk Museum
properties.Description: Atatürk Museum exhibits War of Independence and the first years of Republic at the mansion, Atatürk stayed during his trips to Adana. Overlooking to the Seyhan River, the museum is located on Seyhan Street and it is open to public every day except Mondays

properties.Name: Misis Mosaic Museum
properties.Description: Misis Mosaic Museum exhibits the works that were excavated from Misis Tumulus, most notable are the mosaics that were on the floor of a 4th-century temple in the ancient city of Misis. The museum is founded in 1959 in Yakapinar village on the far east end

properties.Name: Adiyaman Archaeological Museum
properties.Description: When planning began on the Southeastern Anatolia Project at the end of the 1970s, rescue excavations were initiated at many sites in the Euphrates basin around Adiyaman, since many archaeological find spots were threatened by the planned construction .

properties.Name: Afyonkarahisar Archaeological Museum
properties.Description: The time span of the museum exhibits reach around 5000 years from the Bronze Age until today.The artifacts are from the Chalcolithic Age, Bronze Age and the civilizations of Hittites, Phrygians, Ancient Greece and Byzantine Empire collected from excavatio

properties.Name: Victory Museum
properties.Description: The Victory Museum is a national military and war museum in Afyonkarahisar, Turkey, which was used as headquarters by then Commander-in-Chief Mustafa Kemal Pasha (Atatürk), his chief general staff and army commanders before the Great Offensive in August.

properties.Name: Amasya Museum
properties.Description: The museum is housed in a three-story building. The basement contains storeroom, laboratory and service units. In the ground floor, a small exhibition room, a kiosk and a lounge is situated. The upper floor comprises two large exhibition halls containing.

properties.Name: Alanya Archaeological Museum
properties.Description: The museum was founded in 1967. At the time of the museum's opening, the exhibits were provided by the Museum of Anatolian Civilizations in Ankara; these artifacts related to the periods of early Bronze Age, Urartian, Phrygian, and Lidyan.

properties.Name: Antalya Museum
properties.Description: One of Turkey's largest museums, located in Konyaalti, Antalya. It includes 13 exhibition halls and an open air gallery. It covers an area of 7,000 m2  and 5000 works of art are exhibited.

properties.Name: Ataturk's House Museum (Antalya)
properties.Description: The museum is located in a two-storey replica house, which was rebuilt original. Mustafa Kemal Ataturk stayed during his official visits to Antalya in 1930 and 1935 in the mansion that belonged to the governorship of the province.

properties.Name: Dikyamac Museum
properties.Description: The museum was founded in the village of Dikyamac, known formerly as Kamparna, in Arhavi ilce (district) of Artvin Province. When established, the private museum was unique in Artvin Province as being the only museum of the province.

properties.Name: Aydin Archaeological Museum
properties.Description: The museum moved to its new building on April 23, 1973. In the beginning, ethnographical items and archaeological artifacts were exhibited together in the same building. In the following years, the number of artifacts obtained from the scientific archaeol

properties.Name: Museum of the Nationalist Forces in Balýkesir
properties.Description: The original building on the site of the museum was a mansion built for Giridizade Mehmet Pasha, treasurer of the Karasi Sanjak, in 1840. When the first mansion burned down in 1900, a new mansion was built by the treasurer's grandson, Halil Pasha.

properties.Name: Amasra Museum
properties.Description: The foundation of Amasra Museum goes back to 1955 when the collected items, which were stored in a small hall in the municipality building, were opened to the public as an exhibition. In 1969, the museum moved to a former primary school building.

properties.Name: Batman Museum
properties.Description: Perhaps the museum's most important holding is the set of gaming pieces (Turkish: oyun taþlarý) discovered at Basur Hoyuk, in Siirt Province.

properties.Name: Bilecik Museum
properties.Description: An ancient Ottoman building – demolished during the Turkish War of Independence in the 1920s – once stood on the site of the museum. After the liberation of Bilecik, a new building was constructed, for use as a court house.

properties.Name: Bolu Museum
properties.Description: In the archaeology section which situated in the ground floor, the items from Neolithic, Bronze, Phyrgian, Urartu, Lydia, Hellenistic, Roman, Byzantine ages are exhibited. Some of these items are marble, glass, metallic and terra-cota articles.

properties.Name: Bursa Archaeological Museum
properties.Description: Bursa Museum, is a national museum in Bursa, Turkey, exhibiting archaeological artifacts found in and around the province.

properties.Name: Canakkale Archaeological Museum
properties.Description: Canakkale is situated on the Anatolian side of the Dardanelles Strait. It is close to famous Troy of the antiquity. The Dardanelles campaign of World War I is known as Canakkale Savasi in Turkish.

properties.Name: Troy Museum
properties.Description: The niches on the walls of the entrance ramp contain gravestones, large-sized statues, scenes and mural-sized photographs from the various levels of the excavation in Troy.

properties.Name: Denizli Ataturk and Ethnography Museum
properties.Description: The ground floor is the ethnographical section. Ornaments, silver tools, woodwork etc. are displayed in the small rooms. The big room is reserved for weapons such as yatagans, swords, riffles, guns etc. A flag, which was used in a meeting during the War.

properties.Name: Cahit Sitki Taranci Museum
properties.Description: The museum building was the house where Cahit Sitki Taranci (1910–1956), a well known poet, was born in. The building was constructed in 1733. It is a two-story house. The construction material is basalt stone.

properties.Name: Diyarbakir Archaeological Museum
properties.Description: Diyarbakir Archaeological Museum is an archaeological museum in Diyarbakir, Turkey.

properties.Name: Konuralp Museum
properties.Description: There are 1788 archaeological items in the museum. Konuralp is founded on the remains of Prusias ad Hypium of the antiquity. The origin of the exhibited items are from Prusias Ad Hypium.

properties.Name: Edirne Museum
properties.Description: The museum was established in 1925 in a medrese of the Selimiye Mosque with instruction of Atatürk by Dr. Rifat Osman, Arif Dagdeviren and Necmi Ýge.

properties.Name: Eskisehir Aviation Museum
properties.Description: The Governorship of Eskisehir Province and the Turkish Air Force 1st Tactical Air Force Command, which is stationed in Eskisehir, came together for the establishment of an aviation museum.

properties.Name: Caricature Museum
properties.Description: The building is a residence house built in 1900s. It was restored and used as a museum of Anadolu University. Its total service area is 265 square metres. Each room of the house is dedicated to different displays such as, permanent display.

properties.Name: Meerschaum Museum
properties.Description: Sepiolite or Meerschaum is a soft white clay mineral, which is mainly used to handicraft tobacco pipes called Meerschaum pipes. The opaque and off-white, grey or cream colored mineral is soft when extracted. However, it hardens on exposure to solar heat.

properties.Name: Gaziantep Museum of Archaeology
properties.Description: Housed for some years a collection of mosaics, most of which were excavated from the ancient Roman city site of Zeugma. A new museum, the Zeugma Mosaic Museum now houses those.

properties.Name: Hatay Archaeology Museum
properties.Description: The museum is located in Antakya, the main city of Hatay. Construction of the museum started in 1934 on the recommendation of the French archaeologist and antiquities inspector Claude M. Prost.It was completed in 1938 and came under Turkish control in 193

properties.Name: Kahramanmaras Archaeology Museum
properties.Description: According to the Ministry of Culture and Tourism, even in the Medieval Age during the Dulkadir Beylik there was a primitive museum of steles in the Kahramanmaraþ Castle  during the Republican Age the first museum was established in 1947.

properties.Name: Karaman Museum
properties.Description: In the museum there are two halls one reserved for the archaeological items and an one for the ethnographical items. In these halls items from epipaleolithic age, Neolithic age, chalcolithic age, Bronze Age, classic age, Roman Empire, Byzantine Empire etc

properties.Name: Kars Museum
properties.Description: The structure was first built as an Armenian church (The Holy Apostles Church) under the Armenian Bagratuni Dynasty by Abbas II in 930–937. In 1579, it was converted to a mosque. Archaeological works from Kars and its surrounding region.

properties.Name: Kastamonu Ethnography Museum
properties.Description: The 3-storey mansion was built in 1887 by an Ottoman mir-liva ('Brigadier general') Sadýk Pasha. In 1978 it was bought by the Ministry of Culture. In 1997 it was opened as an ethnography museum.

properties.Name: Kayseri Archaeology Museum
properties.Description: The first hall is reserved for the Kultepe ruins. The origin of the clay tablets are either Assyrian trade post (karum) or the Hittite city Kültepe (Nesa). These are the earliest written materials in Turkey (ca 1900 B.C.), pitchers, vases, stamps, bowls e

properties.Name: Kirsehir Museum
properties.Description: In 1936 a mosque was used to keep the ethnographical items. But the museum was not established till 1997. Kaman-Kalehoyuk excavations was instrumental in establishing the museum. The two storey 264 square metres  museum building.

properties.Name: Kocaeli Museum
properties.Description: The railway station was designed by German architect Otto Ritter, and built between 1873 and 1910. The facility covers an area of 21 daa (5.2 acres).The railway station became defunct after the course of the railway.

properties.Name: Konya Ethnography Museum
properties.Description: he museum is on Sahip Ata Street. It is a two-story building with a basement. The basement is reserved for the offices and the photoshop. The conference room is in the ground floor. The museum was established on 6 December 1975.

properties.Name: Konya Archaeological Museum
properties.Description: One of the most prominent displays in the museum is of sarcophagi and other antiquities from the ancient city of Catalhoyuk. Other exhibits relate to the Neolithic, Bronze Age (old-Bronze and mid-Bronze periods), Iron Age (Phrygian and Urartu), etc.

properties.Name: Mardin Museum
properties.Description: The former museum of Mardin was in Zincirli Medrese, a building constructed by the Artukids in the 14th century. The present museum was opened in 1995.The museum building was constructed by an Assyrian patriarchate in 1895.

properties.Name: Tasucu Ataturk Museum
properties.Description: Tasucu and visited the town four times:28 January 1925,12 May 1926,11 February 1931 and 20 February 1935. During these visits he likened Taþucu to Thessaloniki, Greece in which he spent his chilhood.

properties.Name: Mersin Museum
properties.Description: Mersin Province has many ancient sites. Yumuktepe and Soli in Mersin city and Gozlukule in Tarsus are among these. But prior to the foundation Mersin Museum, the findings were exhibited in other museums. Mersin Museum was founded in 1978.

properties.Name: Milas Museum
properties.Description: It is situated in Milas ilçe (district) of Mugla Province . It was established in 1987. The museum is in a two-story building with a 1.5 decares (0.37 acres) yard.Most of the exhibited items are from Stratonicea, Iasos, Damlýboðaz  etc.

properties.Name: Mugla Museum
properties.Description: One section of the museum exhibits the fossils of animals that lived 5-9 million years ago (i.e., Turolian period) from Kaklicatepe, a hill close to Muðla. Another section focuses on archaeology; finds from excavations in Stratonicea excavations.

properties.Name: Hagia Sophia, Trabzon
properties.Description: Formerly Greek Orthodox church which was converted into a mosque in 1584, and located in Trabzon, in the north-eastern part of Turkey. It dates back to the thirteenth century when Trabzon was the capital of the Empire of Trebizond.

properties.Name: Rize Ataturk Museum
properties.Description: The museum building is a three-storey mansion that was built in 1921. In 1924, Mustafa Kemal Pasha (later Ataturk), the founder of Turkey, stayed in this house during his visit to Rize. In 1881, the 100th birth year of Ataturk, the owners of the house.

properties.Name: Ordu Ethnographical Museum
properties.Description: The museum building is a historical building known as Paþaoðlu Mansion. A notable piece of civil architecture, it was built in 1896. In 1982, it was expropriated by the Ministry of Culture. Following a 4 years restoration, it was opened on 18 November 198

properties.Name: Sivas Congress and Ethnography Museum
properties.Description: Between 4–12 September 1919, the building was used by Turkish nationalists as a center for preparation of the Turkish War of Independence (see Sivas Congress). After the congress, Mustafa Kemal Pasha (later Atatürk) and his friends stayed in this building

properties.Name: Sanliurfa Archaeology and Mosaic Museum
properties.Description: The museum opened in 2015, and replaced the former museum of Þanlýurfa on Çamlýk street. With a closed area of 34,000 square metres (370,000 sq ft), it is one of the biggest museums of in Turkey. The museum consists of two major sections.

properties.Name: Sanliurfa Gobeklitepe
properties.Description: Gobeklitepe or Gobekli Tepe is the world's oldest known cult building community located near the Orencik Village, approximately 22 km northeast of the city center of Sanlýurfa. Two higher obelisks are placed mutually in the center of this building.

properties.Name: Anitkabir
properties.Description: Anitkabir (literally, 'memorial tomb') is the mausoleum of Mustafa Kemal Ataturk, the leader of the Turkish War of independence and the founder and first President of the Republic of Turkey.

properties.Name: Ankara Aviation Museum
properties.Description: Ankara Aviation Museum is a military-based museum for aviation, owned and operated by the Turkish Air Force. The museum is located in Etimesgut district of Ankara, Turkey.

properties.Name: Ethnography Museum of Ankara
properties.Description: The Ethnography Museum of Ankara is dedicated to the cultures of Turkic civilizations.  The museum temporarily hosted the sarcophagus of Mustafa Kemal Ataturk from 1938 to 1953, during the period of the construction of Anitkabir, his final resting place.

properties.Name: Republic Museum
properties.Description: Republic Museum (also known as 'Second parliament Building of Turkey') is a museum in Ankara, Turkey, which was the Turkish Parliament building from 1924–1960.

properties.Name: Feza Gursey Science Center
properties.Description: Feza Gursey Science Center (Turkish: Feza Gursey Bilim Merkezi, FGBM) is a science museum in Ankara, Turkey (1921 - 1992). The renowned Turkish mathematician and physicist. The original exhibits were built by the Ontario Science Centre in Toronto Canada.

properties.Name: Gordion Museum
properties.Description: The exhibits include the Phrygian and other archaeological items, especially those of King Midas. There is also a chronological exhibition of later artifacts including Hellenistic and Roman Empire items and also a coinage section.

properties.Name: Erimtan Archaeology and Arts Museum
properties.Description: Erimtan Archaeology and Arts Museum is an archaeology museum and music venue in Ankara, Turkey. The collection covers a period of time extending from three thousand BC to the Byzantine times.

properties.Name: Cengelhan Rahmi M. Koc Museum
properties.Description: The Cengelhan Rahmi M. Koc Museum is a technology museum in Ankara. The lower floor is reserved for a carpet gallery, agricultural machinery and pharmaceutical exhibits. Machines, medicine, everyday life tools and road transport vehicles.

properties.Name: Gokyay Association Chess Museum
properties.Description: The museum has the largest chess set collection in the world with 703 chess sets collected from 110 countries exhibited under four main themes in a 1,008 square metre area. Museum located in Altindað, Ankara, Turkey and displayed in a historical home.

properties.Name: Isbank Museum
properties.Description: The official name of the museum is 'Economic Independence Museum'. This is the second museum of the bank the first being the Ýþbank Museum in Ýstanbul. The museum is in Ulus Square facing the Victory Monument.

properties.Name: METU Science and Technology Museum
properties.Description: The Museum established within the campus of the Middle East Technical University, Ankara, Turkey. The museum is aimed to present the modern technological tools as well as technological past of Turkey.(Turkish: ODTÜ Bilim ve Teknoloji Müzesi)

properties.Name: Museum of Anatolian Civilizations
properties.Description: The first museum in Ankara was established by Mübarek Galip Bey, Directorate of Culture, in 1921, in the section of the Castle of Ankara called Akkale.

properties.Name: Roman Baths of Ankara
properties.Description: The Roman Baths of Ankara are the ruined remains of an ancient Roman bath complex in Ankara, Turkey, which were uncovered by excavations carried out in 1937-1944, and have subsequently been opened to the public as an open-air museum.

properties.Name: State Art and Sculpture Museum
properties.Description: The museum dedicated to fine arts and sculpture in Ankara, Turkey. It was designed in 1927 by architect Arif Hikmet Koyunoðlu and built between 1927 and 1930 as the Turkocagý Building upon the direction of Mustafa Kemal Atatürk.

properties.Name: TCDD Open Air Steam Locomotive Museum
properties.Description: The TCDD Open Air Steam Locomotive Museum (Turkish: TCDD Açýk Hava Buharlý Lokomotif Müzesi) is a railroad museum in Ankara, Turkey, which traces the history of steam locomotives. The museum is owned and operated by the Turkish State Railways (TCDD).

properties.Name: Ulucanlar Prison Museum
properties.Description: The Ulucanlar Prison Museum is a former state prison in Ankara, Turkey that was converted into a prison museum following restoration by Altýndað Municipality. It is the first museum of its kind in Turkey.The museum was opened in 2011.

properties.Name: War of Independence Museum
properties.Description: The War of Independence Museum (Kurtuluþ Savaþý Müzesi), housed in the first Turkish Grand National Assembly building in the Ulus district of Ankara, Turkey, displays important photographs, documents and furniture from the Turkish War of Independence.

properties.Name: Museum of the Princes Islands
properties.Description: Museum of the Princes Islands is a museum on Büyükada of Princes Islands in Ýstanbul Province, Turkey dedicated to the past of the Princes' Islands. The biggest island of the archipelago, off the Anatolian side of Ýstanbul in theSea of Marmara .

properties.Name: Adam Mickiewicz Museum
properties.Description: Adam Mickiewicz Museum (Polish: Muzeum Adama Mickiewicza) is a historic house museum dedicated to the life of Adam Mickiewicz, renowned Polish poet. It is located in the district of Beyoðlu, on the European side of Istanbul, Turkey.

properties.Name: Ahmet Hamdi Tanpinar Literature Museum Library
properties.Description: The Ahmet Hamdi Tanpinar Literature Museum Library is a literary museum and archive dedicated to Turkish literature and named after the Turkish novelist and essayist Ahmet Hamdi Tanpýnar (1901–1962).

properties.Name: Anadoluhisari
properties.Description: Anadoluhisari known historically as Güzelce Hisar is a medieval fortress located in Istanbul on the Anatolian (Asian) side of the Bosporus. The complex is the oldest surviving Turkish architectural structure built in Istanbul.

properties.Name: Asiyan Museum
properties.Description: Asiyan Museum is the house of famous Turkish poet Tevfik Fikret (1867-1915) at Aþiyan neighborhood of Beþiktaþ district in Istanbul. It was built in 1906 and later in 1945 converted to a museum.

properties.Name: Ataturk Museum
properties.Description: Ataturk Museum is a historic house museum dedicated to the life of Mustafa Kemal Ataturk, the first president of the Republic of Turkey. The museum houses personal belongings of Ataturk like clothes and collections, other than historical documents, etc.

properties.Name: Istanbul Aviation Museum
properties.Description: The Istanbul Aviation Museum, is a military-based museum for aviation, owned and operated by the Turkish Air Force. The museum not only presents various warplanes, helicopters and weapons used by the Turkish Air Force.

properties.Name: Aynalýkavak Pavilion
properties.Description: Aynalikavak Pavilion is a former Ottoman pavilion located in the Hasköy. It was constructed during the reign of Sultan Ahmed I (1603-1617), with various additions and changes over time.

properties.Name: Beylerbeyi Palace
properties.Description: The Beylerbeyi Palace, Beylerbeyi meaning 'Lord of Lords', is located in the Beylerbeyi neighbourhood of Uskudar. An Imperial Ottoman summer residence built in the 1860s, it is now situated immediately north of the 1973 Bosphorus Bridge.

properties.Name: Dogancay Museum
properties.Description: The Dogancay Museum, Turkey’s first modern art museum, is dedicated to the artistic legacy of Burhan Dogancay.It is housed in a historic 150-year-old five-story building - once an elegant home to a Greek family - located in the heart of bustling Beyoglu.

properties.Name: Dolmabahce Palace
properties.Description: Dolmabahce Palace  located in the Besiktas district of Istanbul on the European coast of the Strait of Istanbul, served as the main administrative center of the Ottoman Empire from 1856 to 1887 and from 1909 to 1922.

properties.Name: Great Palace Mosaic Museum
properties.Description: The Great Palace Mosaic Museum (Buyuk Saray Mozaikleri Muzesi), is located close to Sultanahmet Square in Istanbul, Turkey, at Arasta Bazaar. The museum houses mosaics from the Byzantine period, unearthed at the site of the Great Palace of Constantinople.

properties.Name: Ayasofia
properties.Description: Hagia Sophia is the former Greek Orthodox Christian patriarchal cathedral, later an Ottoman imperial mosque and now a museum. Built in AD 537, during the reign of Justinian. It is famous for its large dome. It was the world's largest building.

properties.Name: Ihlamur Pavilion
properties.Description: Ihlamur Palace (Turkish: Ihlamur Kasri), is a former imperial Ottoman summer pavilion located in Istanbul, Turkey. It was constructed during the reign of Sultan Abdulmecid I (1839-1860).

properties.Name: Istanbul Archaeology Museums
properties.Description: The Istanbul Archaeology Museums are a group of three archaeological museums located in the Eminonu district of Istanbul, Turkey, near Gulhane Park and Topkapý Palace.

properties.Name: Istanbul Contemporary Art Museum
properties.Description: Istanbul Contemporary Art Museum (iS.CaM) is an independent, artist run museum established in Istanbul in 1997. It is the oldest contemporary art museum in Istanbul. iS.CaM an alternative art organisation that develops, evolves and collaborates.

properties.Name: Istanbul Naval Museum
properties.Description: The Istanbul Naval Museum is a national naval museum, located at Besiktas district of Istanbul. It was established in 1897 by the Ottoman Minister of Navy Bozcaadalý Hasan Husnu Pasha. The museum contains an important collection of military artifacts.

properties.Name: Istanbul Railway Museum
properties.Description: The Istanbul Railway Museum is a railway museum situated within the historic Ýstanbul Sirkeci Terminal at Sirkeci neighborhood of Fatih district in Istanbul. In the museum, which is housed in the 1888-built and 1890-opened railway terminal.

properties.Name: Istanbul State Art and Sculpture Museum
properties.Description: Istanbul State Art and Sculpture Museum is a museum in Istanbul, Turkey.The museum is in Dolmabahce Palace in Visnezade neighborhood of Istanbul. The building, just like the rest of the palace, was built in 1856. It was the mansion of the crown prince.

properties.Name: Istanbul Toy Museum
properties.Description: The museum was founded by the Turkish poet and novelist, Sunay Akin, in 2005. Currently, the museum has on display 4,000 toys and miniatures from Turkey and abroad; many of the exhibits are antiques, some of which date back nearly 200 years.

properties.Name: Istanbul Zoology Museum
properties.Description: Zoology Museum of Istanbul University is a natural history museum, located in Istanbul University's Vezneciler Campus, featuring animal collections. It was founded in 1933 and rearranged in 1989.

properties.Name: Jewish Museum of Turkey
properties.Description: Jewish Museum of Turkey (officially Quincentennial Foundation Museum of Turkish Jews) is a cultural center established by the Quincentennial Foundation to inform the society of the traditions and history of Turkish Jewry.

properties.Name: Kucuksu Pavilion
properties.Description: Kucuksu Pavilion, a.k.a. Goksu Pavilion, is a summer pavilion in Istanbul, Turkey, situated in the Kucuksu on the Asian shore of the Bosphorus between Anadoluhisarý and the FSM Bridge.

properties.Name: Natural History Museum of Ihsan Ketin
properties.Description: Ihsan Ketin Natural History Museum is a museum within the Mining Engineering Faculty of Istanbul Technical University. The exhibited collections are; Darwin 2000 Beagle series,Istanbul invertebrate fossils,Zonguldak fossil flora, Solnhofen fossil fauna, e

properties.Name: Istanbul Military Museum
properties.Description: Istanbul Military Museum  is dedicated to one thousand years of Turkish military history. It is one of the leading museums of its kind in the world. The museum is open to the public everyday except Mondays and Tuesdays.

properties.Name: Museum of Illumination and Heating Appliances
properties.Description: The Museum of Illumination and Heating Appliances is a small, privately run museum adjacent to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. The museum houses a large collection of antique and archaic heating and lighting appliances.

properties.Name: Pammakaristos Church
properties.Description: Church of Theotokos Pammakaristos is one of the most famous Greek Orthodox Byzantine churches in Istanbul.Adapted in 1591 into the Fethiye Mosque it is today partly a museum,the parekklesion.

properties.Name: Pera Museum
properties.Description: Pera Museum is an art museum in the Tepebasi quarter of the Beyoglu (Pera) district in Istanbul. It has a particular focus on Orientalism in 19th-century art.The museum is located in the historic building of the former Bristol Hotel.

properties.Name: Platform Garanti Contemporary Art Center
properties.Description: The contemporary art institution Garanti Contemporary Art Center opened in 2001 and was located on the pedestrian Istiklal Avenue. Platform Garanti organized exhibitions; conferences and events; hosted an international residency program.

properties.Name: Elgiz Museum
properties.Description: Elgiz Museum is a private collection museum, founded by Dr. Can Elgiz. Established with a mission to promote the development of contemporary art in Turkey, the initiative focused on giving space, support and international visibility to projects.

properties.Name: Rezan Has Museum
properties.Description: The Rezan Has Museum is a private museum in Istanbul dedicated to culture and arts. Rezan Has, spouse of the wealthy Turkish businessman Kadir Has, founded the museum in May 2007.

properties.Name: Rumelihisarý
properties.Description: Rumelihisari is a medieval fortress located in Istanbul, Turkey, on a series of hills on the European banks of the Bosphorus. The fortress also lends its name to the immediate neighborhood around it in the city's Sariyer district.

properties.Name: SadberkHanimMuseum
properties.Description: The Sadberk Hanim Museum is a private museum located at the Bosporus which was established by the memory of Vehbi Koc’s wife Sadberk.The original building is a three-story plus an attic wooden mansion.

properties.Name: Sait Faik Abasiyanik Museum
properties.Description: Sait Faik Abasiyanik Museum is a historic house museum dedicated to the writer Sait Faik Abasiyanik in Istanbul, Turkey. The museum is on Burgazada Island of Adalar district in Istanbul Province, one of the Princes' Islands archipelago.

properties.Name: Sakip Sabanci Museum
properties.Description: The Sabanci University Sakip Sabanci Museum is a private fine arts museum in Istanbul, Turkey dedicated to calligraphic art, religious and state documents, as well as paintings of the Ottoman era.The museum was founded by was founded by Sakip Sabanci.

properties.Name: Santral Istanbul
properties.Description: The SantralIstanbul, opened in 2007, is an arts and cultural complex located at the upper end of Golden Horn in the Eyup district of Istanbul, Turkey. The center, consisting of an energy museum, an amphitheater, concert halls and a public library.

properties.Name: The Museum of Innocence
properties.Description: The Museum of Innocence is a museum in a 19th-century house in Istanbul (Cukurcuma) created by novelist Orhan Pamuk as a companion to his novel The Museum of Innocence. The museum and the novel were created in tandem.

properties.Name: Topkapi Palace
properties.Description: The Topkapi Palace is a large museum in the east of the Fatih. In the 15th and 16th centuries it served as the main residence and administrative headquarters of the Ottoman sultans.Construction, ordered by the Sultan Mehmed the Conqueror, began in 1459.

properties.Name: Turkish and Islamic Arts Museum
properties.Description: The Turkish and Islamic Arts Museum is a museum located in Sultanahmet Square in Fatih.Constructed in 1524, the building was formerly the palace of Pargalý Ibrahim Pasha, who was the second grand vizier to Suleiman the Magnificent.

properties.Name: Yildiz Palace
properties.Description: Yildiz Palace is a vast complex of former imperial Ottoman pavilions and villas in Istanbul, Turkey, built in the 19th and early 20th centuries. It was used as a residence by the Sultan and his court in the late 19th century.

properties.Name: Camlik Railway Museum
properties.Description: The Camlýk Railway Museum, is an outdoor railway museum at Camlýk village of Selcuk district in Izmir Province, Turkey. It is the largest railway museum in Turkey and contains one of the largest steam locomotive collections in Europe.

properties.Name: Cesme Museum
properties.Description: The castle was commissioned by Sultan Bayezid II of the Ottoman Empire in 1502. In 1965, the museum was established as a weapons museum, but high moisture caused some rusting in the metallic parts of the weapons and they were transferred to other museums.

properties.Name: Natural History Museum of Ege University
properties.Description: The museum is in the campus of the Ege University next to Faculty of Science. The museum was founded in 1973. Between 1973 and 1991 it was an institute of the faculty. After 1991 it became a subunit of the rectorship.

properties.Name: Izmir Archaeological and Ethnography Museum
properties.Description: It was built on the site of an abandoned church, called Saint Voukolos Church. The museum opened to the public in 1927.The museum was later moved to the National Education Pavilion in the Culture Park, which in turn was converted into a museum in 1951.

properties.Name: Izmir Art and Sculpture Museum
properties.Description: Established by the Turkish state in 1952 as the Ýzmir State Painting and Sculpture Museum, the museum was later moved from the Kulturpark to its present location on Ataturk Boulevard near the Konak pier.

properties.Name: Izmir Toy Museum
properties.Description: The museum was established by ceramic artist, Umran Baradan. She donated a two-storey house and toys she had purchased in various countries. Later, Sunay Akin, who had previously founded Istanbul Toy Museum, contributed various items to the museum.

properties.Name: Tire City Museum
properties.Description: Tire City Museum is located in Tire district in Ýzmir Province, Turkey.The building is the former city hall of Tire. It was built in 1955. After the construction of a newer building for the municipality, the former building was restored and opened as Tire

properties.Name: Bergama Museum
properties.Description: Bergama is a historically important city. Although the most important ancient monument of Bergama, namely the Pergamon Altar had been transported to Pergamon Museum in Berlin, Germany in 1870, there are still enough items to be displayed in Bergama.

properties.Name: Ali Demirsoy Natural History Museum
properties.Description: The museum is in the campus of Haci Ali Akin Multi-Program Highschool in Kemaliye district, of Erzincan Province. Its founder is Professor Ali Demirsoy of Hacettepe University. It is supported by Tubitak.

properties.Name: Elazig Archaeology and Ethnography Museum
properties.Description: In 1965 a museum was established in a historical building in Harput,. During the construction of two hydro electric plants; Keban Dam and Karakaya Dam both of which are on Fýrat River and quite close to Elazig, many items worthy of museum were found.

properties.Name: Sinop Archaeological Museum
properties.Description: A joint team of German and Turkish archaeologists, led by Ludwig Budde and Ekrem Akurgal, carried out excavations in the center of Sinop and at Kocagöz Tumulis in Demircikoy between 1951 and 1953.

properties.Name: Usak Museum of Archaeology
properties.Description: In the museum, items on display include sculptures, pitchers with beaklike spouts and stone axes from the Bronze Age, earthen dishes and glassware from the Hellenistic and Ancient Roman Period, and stelae from the nearby Roman ancient ruin site of Blaundu

properties.Name: Van Urartu Museum
properties.Description: A warehouse building built in 1932.The Urartu cuneiform victory steles found in the region and the ram and sheep-shaped tomb stones belonging to Akkoyunlu and Karakoyunlu were collected from their locations and transferred to this warehouse building.

properties.Name: Van Akdamar Museum
properties.Description: Akdamar Memorial Museum is a church located in the Gevaþ district of Van, accessible by a motor ride. The fascinating building, which was built as a palace church by the Armenian Vaspurakan King Gagik Ardsruni I, hosts many local and foreign tourists ever
